Class FoodItem

java.lang.Object
FoodItem
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Comparator<FoodItem>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Fruit, Preserve, Vegetable
public class FoodItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<FoodItem>
Assessment: Assignment 2 Duedate: October 17th 2021 Professor Name: James Mwangi Student Name: Kyle Thomas Description: A Store management program with the ability to import and export inventories
See Also:
Preserve, Vegetable, Fruit, Assign2, Inventory, FoodItem

  • Method Details

    • updateItem

      public boolean updateItem​(int amount)
      Method created to update the item quantity of a created FoodItem object. As this method is boolean, it has two parts which one returns true, and the other returns false. A false can only be triggered in the case where the Itemquantityinstock is LESS than what is being sold (subtracted) Since, well you can't have a negative inventory for this program. Maybe in the future it could mean pre-orders or something. Anyways, methods returns true if no errors occur. Since there are no quantity caps, no matter how high the quantity is it will always return true.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount of stock being either added or subtracted from the stock count
      Returns:
      returns whether the action was able to be complete (true) or not (false)

    • isEqual

      public boolean isEqual​(FoodItem foodItem)
      checks if the inputed user item code is the same the checked item code. If the code is the same, true is returned. else false.
      Parameters:
      foodItem - Checks the food item object for the item codes
      Returns:
      returns true if the item code exists or false if it does not.

    • addItem

      public boolean addItem​(java.util.Scanner input)
      Receives user input information to create a food item object. called as a super() and it changes based on what object type is being made.
      Parameters:
      input - the user input
      Returns:
      returns true if nothing fails

    • inputCode

      public boolean inputCode​(java.util.Scanner input)
      method to accept the input of a Code for an item not sure why this exists tbh
      Parameters:
      input - user input
      Returns:
      If code is value return true, else false.

    • compare

      public int compare​(FoodItem f1, FoodItem f2)
      Used to compare two food items. Specifically, compares food item ItemCodes and then places them in order.
